title: My Roommate Keeps Eating My Ramen
self_text: Seriously considering moving out. He consistently eats my instant ramen, even though I clearly label it with my name and a giant sticker. Last night, I came home to an empty container and a note that said "Sorry, it was delicious!" He doesn’t even ask. Just takes it. I’ve asked politely, firmly, and even jokingly, but nothing changes. I’m starting to resent him. Is this a reasonable reaction? Should I just accept my fate as a perpetually ramen-less roommate, or is there a way to resolve this without a dramatic confrontation?

title: Lost Dog - Missing Since Yesterday Afternoon
self_text: Our beagle, Gus, went missing yesterday afternoon around 3 PM near Central Park West. He’s a medium-sized brown and white beagle with floppy ears and a distinctive white patch on his chest. Last seen wearing a blue collar with a silver tag. We’re heartbroken and desperately searching. If you’ve seen him, please contact us immediately at [Phone Number] or [Email Address]. Reward offered!

title: My cat peeing and crapping in kitchen sink
self_text: My 6-7 year old cat Sophie, just recently started using my kitchen sink as litterbox. Took her to the vet to check for UTI or any other issues and they said she was fine. I took in a 6-8 month old kitten about a year ago and while they never really got along, they never got into any physical fights (that I'm aware of). New female "Kitten", Cali tries to play with Sophie by hiding and jumping out at her. She does the same to my older male cat, but he doesn't pay her any mind. Sophie however always runs to kitchen counter and will hiss and growl. I first introduced both of my original cats to the new kitten very gradually. Keeping new kitten in spare bedroom for 2-3 weeks. All three got along *reasonably* well for the first 6 months or so after I let the new kitten out into main house, but now it seems like things are getting worse. Not sure what to do...maybe put Cali back into the spare room while I'm at work? IDK. Her mess looks normal like normal cat poop. She doesnt yell or seem like she’s straining. She does meow alot amd want to go outside a lot so sometime I let her go all the time then she comes back into the house for a couple days then wanta to go outside.  We dont have other animals. And it's just my wife and i. Maybe someone can help me out with this?

title: My cat peeing and crapping in kitchen sink
self_text:
My 6-7 year old cat Sophie, just recently started using my kitchen sink as litterbox. Took her to the vet to check for UTI or any other issues and they said she was fine. I took in a 6-8 month old kitten about a year ago and while they never really got along, they never got into any physical fights (that I'm aware of). New female “Kitten”, Cali tries to play with Sophie by hiding and jumping out at her. She does the same to my older male cat, but he doesn't pay her any mind. Sophie however always runs to kitchen counter and will hiss and growl. I first introduced both of my original cats to the new kitten very gradually. Keeping new kitten in spare bedroom for 2-3 weeks. All three got along *reasonably* well for the first 6 months or so after I let the new kitten out into main house, but now it seems like things are getting worse. Not sure what to do...maybe put Cali back into the spare room while I'm at work? IDK. Her mess looks normal like normal cat poop. She doesn’t yell or seem like she’s straining. Cats always running around the house and outside too with plenty of energy so I don’t think she’s sick at all. I’ve always used the PURINA tidy cats 24/7 litter. She doesn’t use it. One thing i seen though... I’ve gotten accustomed to putting down a trail of paper towels to help with absorption and all that and she will do business on the paper towls, then hell try to kick over the papers if he can, to cover his mess, so I know hes still trained. His mess looks normal like normal cat poop. title: CatAdvice

title: Please stop suggesting lootboxes return
self_text: This should be less an issue of wanting the old monetization system back, and more an issue of them making a system that is worse than a system that was still bad. If you protest and protest until they bring back lootboxes you will be bringing back a system that guarantees nothing and is basically a virtual slot machine in which all new content will be walled behind. Don't ask for lesser evils. Ask for a consumer friendly shop.

Overwatch

title: My cat peeing and crapping in kitchen sink
self_text: My 6-7 year old cat Sophie, just recently started using my kitchen sink as litterbox. Took her to the vet to check for UTI or any other issues and they said she was fine. I took in a 6-8 month old kitten about a year ago and while they never really got along, they never got into any physical fights (that I'm aware of). New female "Kitten", Cali tries to play with Sophie by hiding and jumping out at her. She does the same to my older male cat, but he doesn't pay her any mind. Sophie however always runs to kitchen counter and will hiss and growl. I first introduced both of my original cats to the new kitten very gradually. Keeping new kitten in spare bedroom for 2-3 weeks. All three got along *reasonably* well for the first 6 months or so after I let the new kitten out into main house, but now it seems like things are getting worse. Not sure what to do...maybe put Cali back into the spare room while I'm at work? IDK. Her mess looks normal like normal cat poop. She doesn’t yell or seem like she’s straining. Cats always run around the house and outside too with plenty of energy so I don’t think she’s sick at all. I’ve always used the PURINA tidy cats 24/7 litter. She doesn’t use it. One thing i seen though... i’ve gotten accustomed to putting down a trail of paper towels to help with absorption and all that and she will do business on the paper towls, then hell try to kick over the papers if he can, to cover his mess.  Her mess looks normal like normal cat poop. She doesn’t yell or seem like she’s straining. Cats always run around the house and outside too with plenty of energy so I don’t think she’s sick at all. I’ve tried placing her poop in the litter box. I changed the litter to that expensive one that supposed to guarantee your cat will love it because its supposed to be scented that way but she doesn’t use it. I’ve tried moving the litter box to the area in the kitchen and just dies her business around the box.  Could you provide any assistance?

title: My Albino Cory is going crazy and I’m worried
self_text: Alright, so I have a 29 Gallon tank. I have 5 Guppies 3 Mollies and until yesterday 3 Corydoras.   The pet store only had 3 Cory’s left when I bought them. I know they need a school of at least 6 so I bought 4 more Cory’s yesterday. (Also 3 little pink shrimp and a Nerite Snail)   Now today my Albino is going freaking nuts, it’s swimming up down and left and right non-stop a million miles a minute for hours.   I’ve tested my waters and everything is fine my PH is a bit high 7.8 as far as I can tell. I quickly ran to the pet store and put some moss stuff in there and the little guy is still rippin.   Is he sick? What should I do? Also he wont school with the Pandas (I have 6 pandas and 1 albino) the pet store said it was really weird they wont school.
